item.title: This week's critical inflation report comes with a variety of doubts about the data
item.description: The September CPI report will command full attention from financial markets, even as some investors will view the data with a skeptical eye.

item.title: Rare earths make gains amid battle to beat Chinaâ€™s dominance
item.description: Shares of U.S.-listed companies related to the rare earth supply chain climbed on Monday.

item.title: Tariff costs to companies this year to hit $1.2 trillion, with consumers taking most of the hit, S&P says
item.description: The firm said its estimate of additional expenses for companies is probably conservative.

item.title: U.S. budget deficit edged lower in 2025 as tariffs, debt payments both saw new records
item.description: The federal government managed to escape with a $1.78 trillion shortfall, some $41 billion, or 2.2%, less than fiscal 2024.

item.title: CEOs of Wells Fargo and Pfizer caution the U.S. could lose its edge to China without innovation
item.description: Speaking at CNBC's Invest in America Forum, the CEOs said the U.S. still leads in many sectors, but inconsistent policy and underinvestment is ceding ...
